com.cloudera.oryx.common

Class ReloadingReference<V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cloudera.oryx.common.ReloadingReference<V>
  • Type Parameters:
    V - type of referent encapsulated and reloaded by this class
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.google.common.base.Supplier<V>

    public final class ReloadingReference<V>
extends Object
implements com.google.common.base.Supplier<V>
    Encapsulates a reference to something that is created the first time it is needed. Instead of providing an initial value, a Callable is given that can create the thing is provided. This can also periodically re-create or reload the value.
    Author:
    Sean Owen

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ReloadingReference(Callable<V> retriever)
      A ReloadingReference that never reloads the reference after it is loaded once.
      ReloadingReference(Callable<V> retriever, long duration, TimeUnit timeUnit)
      A ReloadingReference that reloads if the loaded value was loaded longer ago than the given duration.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clear()
      Clears the reference, requiring a load on next access.
      V get() 
      V get(long timeout, TimeUnit timeUnit)
      Like get(), but when a value already exists, will only wait for the given amount of time before just proceeding to return the existing value instead of waiting for a new value to load.
      V maybeGet() 

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • ReloadingReference

        public ReloadingReference(Callable<V> retriever)
        A ReloadingReference that never reloads the reference after it is loaded once.
        Parameters:
        retriever - object that can supply a new, current value of the reference

      • ReloadingReference

        public ReloadingReference(Callable<V> retriever,
                  long duration,
                  TimeUnit timeUnit)
        A ReloadingReference that reloads if the loaded value was loaded longer ago than the given duration.
        Parameters:
        retriever - object that can supply a new, current value of the reference
        duration - time after which a new value will be loaded, or NO_RELOAD to not reload after the initial value is loaded
        timeUnit - units of time for duration

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public V get(long timeout,
    TimeUnit timeUnit)
        Like get(), but when a value already exists, will only wait for the given amount of time before just proceeding to return the existing value instead of waiting for a new value to load.

      • get

        public V get()
        Specified by:
        get in interface com.google.common.base.Supplier<V>
        Returns:
        object that is returned by the provided Callable. If not yet created, it will block and wait for creation. If already created, it will return the existing value. The value will be re-created periodically, if the object has been configured to, and when this is needed, this method will again block while the value is re-created.

      • maybeGet

        public V maybeGet()
        Returns:
        object that is returned by the provided Callable, if it has already been created previously, or null otherwise

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clears the reference, requiring a load on next access.
